ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: Visit name
The rate of suicide in my state is lower than the national average.
Youth aged 10 to 24 have a significantly greater risk of suicide than individuals aged 65 or older.
The rate of suicide among those with severe mental illnesses is how many times that of the general population?
If a person is serious about suicide, there is little that can be done to prevent it.
Notes: 1= Strongly Disagree; 2= Disagree; 3= Neutral; 4= Agree; 5= Strongly Agree; 888= Don't Know; 999= NA

ElementDescription: Suicidal people want to die.
Notes: 1= Strongly Disagree; 2= Disagree; 3= Neutral; 4= Agree; 5= Strongly Agree; 888= Don't Know; 999= NA

ElementDescription: Suicide is always unpredictable.
Notes: 1= Strongly Disagree; 2= Disagree; 3= Neutral; 4= Agree; 5= Strongly Agree; 888= Don't Know; 999= NA

ElementDescription: If you talk to someone about suicide, you may inadvertently give that person permission to seriously consider it.
Notes: 1= Strongly Disagree; 2= Disagree; 3= Neutral; 4= Agree; 5= Strongly Agree; 888= Don't Know; 999= NA

ElementDescription: Depression indicates a suicide risk.
Notes: 1= Strongly Disagree; 2= Disagree; 3= Neutral; 4= Agree; 5= Strongly Agree; 888= Don't Know; 999= NA

ElementDescription: Individuals with Borderline Personality Disorder frequently discuss or gesture suicide but do not really intend to kill themselves; instead they intend to provoke or manipulate others.
Notes: 1= Strongly Disagree; 2= Disagree; 3= Neutral; 4= Agree; 5= Strongly Agree; 888= Don't Know; 999= NA

ElementDescription: People have a right to suicide.
Notes: 1= Strongly Disagree; 2= Disagree; 3= Neutral; 4= Agree; 5= Strongly Agree; 888= Don't Know; 999= NA

ElementDescription: Few people want to kill themselves.
Notes: 1= Strongly Disagree; 2= Disagree; 3= Neutral; 4= Agree; 5= Strongly Agree; 888= Don't Know; 999= NA

ElementDescription: I am comfortable asking direct and open questions about suicide.
Notes: 1= Strongly Disagree; 2= Disagree; 3= Neutral; 4= Agree; 5= Strongly Agree; 888= Don't Know; 999= NA

ElementDescription: I always ask about suicide with new clients.
Notes: 1= Strongly Disagree; 2= Disagree; 3= Neutral; 4= Agree; 5= Strongly Agree; 888= Don't Know; 999= NA

ElementDescription: I bring up the topic of suicide with clients whenever I suspect they may be at risk.
Notes: 1= Strongly Disagree; 2= Disagree; 3= Neutral; 4= Agree; 5= Strongly Agree; 888= Don't Know; 999= NA

ElementDescription: I bring up the topic of suicide with clients when their record indicates any history of suicidal thoughts or behaviors.
Notes: 1= Strongly Disagree; 2= Disagree; 3= Neutral; 4= Agree; 5= Strongly Agree; 888= Don't Know; 999= NA

ElementDescription: I  know how to gather information about suicide warning signs, risk factors, and protective factors from suicidal clients.
Notes: 1= Strongly Disagree; 2= Disagree; 3= Neutral; 4= Agree; 5= Strongly Agree; 888= Don't Know; 999= NA

ElementDescription: I use supervision when working with suicidal clients.
Notes: 1= Strongly Disagree; 2= Disagree; 3= Neutral; 4= Agree; 5= Strongly Agree; 888= Don't Know; 999= NA

ElementDescription: I  develop a collaborative safety plan with all suicidal clients.
Notes: 1= Strongly Disagree; 2= Disagree; 3= Neutral; 4= Agree; 5= Strongly Agree; 888= Don't Know; 999= NA

ElementDescription: I address access to lethal methods (e.g., firearms) with all clients who report thoughts of suicide and involve family members in the removal or restriction of means.
Notes: 1= Strongly Disagree; 2= Disagree; 3= Neutral; 4= Agree; 5= Strongly Agree; 888= Don't Know; 999= NA

ElementDescription: I involve family members or other supportive persons in my treatment and discharge plans for clients at risk for suicide.
Notes: 1= Strongly Disagree; 2= Disagree; 3= Neutral; 4= Agree; 5= Strongly Agree; 888= Don't Know; 999= NA

ElementDescription: I am comfortable connecting my suicidal clients with the resources they need in the community (e.g., housing, transportation, vocational programs, volunteer opportunities, additional treatment providers, etc.)
Notes: 1= Strongly Disagree; 2= Disagree; 3= Neutral; 4= Agree; 5= Strongly Agree; 888= Don't Know; 999= NA

ElementDescription: I have received the training I need to engage and assist those with suicidal desire and/or intent.
Notes: 1= Strongly Disagree; 2= Disagree; 3= Neutral; 4= Agree; 5= Strongly Agree; 888= Don't Know; 999= NA

ElementDescription: I have the skills to screen and assess a patient/client's suicide risk.
Notes: 1= Strongly Disagree; 2= Disagree; 3= Neutral; 4= Agree; 5= Strongly Agree; 888= Don't Know; 999= NA

ElementDescription: I have the skills I need to treat people with suicidal desire and/or intent.
Notes: 1= Strongly Disagree; 2= Disagree; 3= Neutral; 4= Agree; 5= Strongly Agree; 888= Don't Know; 999= NA

ElementDescription: I have the support/supervision I need to engage and assist people with suicidal desire and/or intent.
Notes: 1= Strongly Disagree; 2= Disagree; 3= Neutral; 4= Agree; 5= Strongly Agree; 888= Don't Know; 999= NA

ElementDescription: I am confident in my ability to assess a patient's/client's suicide risk.
Notes: 1= Strongly Disagree; 2= Disagree; 3= Neutral; 4= Agree; 5= Strongly Agree; 888= Don't Know; 999= NA

ElementDescription: I am confident in my ability to manage a patient/client's suicidal thoughts and behavior
Notes: 1= Strongly Disagree; 2= Disagree; 3= Neutral; 4= Agree; 5= Strongly Agree; 888= Don't Know; 999= NA

ElementDescription: I am confident in my ability to treat a patient/client's suicidal thoughts and behavior using an evidence-based approach such as DBT or CBT
Notes: 1= Strongly Disagree; 2= Disagree; 3= Neutral; 4= Agree; 5= Strongly Agree; 888= Don't Know; 999= NA

ElementDescription: I have worked with a patient/client who ended his/her life by suicide
Notes: 0=No; 1=Yes, it has happened once; 2=Yes, it has happened more than once; 888=Don't Know

ElementDescription: While this is not an exhaustive list, please choose the category that best describes your position. My primary professional role is:
Notes: 1=Management (Administrators, Supervisors, Managers, Coordinators); 2=Business, Administrative, and Clerical (Accounting, Reception, Human Resources, Billing, Records, Information Technology); 3=Facility Operations (Dietary, Housekeeping, Maintenance, Security, Transportation); 4=Behavioral Health Clinician (Counselor, Social Worker, Substance Abuse Counselor, Therapist, Psychologist); 5=Adjunct Therapist (Activity, Occupational, Physical, Rehabilitation); 6=Case Management; 7=Crisis Services; 8=Physical Health Care/Medication Management (Physician, Nurse Practitioner, Physician's Assistant); 9=Nursing; 10=Psychiatry; 11=Technician (Mental Health Technician, Behavioral Technician, Patient Care Assistance, Residential Technician); 12=Support Outreach (Outreach, Faith, Family Support, Peer Support); 13=Education

ElementDescription: I work primarily with:
Notes: 1=Elderly; 2=Adults; 3=Adolescents; 4=Children; 5=Youth and Adults; 6=My primary role is administration; 7=I don't work directly with patients/clients and my primary role is not administration
